page.title: 20Saint Etheldreda's Church
page.content: Records dated 1504 show that Guilsboro' church was formerly dedicated to Saint Wilfred.No record exists of it's re- dedication to its' present name.The tower was built in the 13th century and is of sandstone,as is the nave,the north and south aisles,the chancel and the north and south porches.The lime- stone spire is dated 1618 but that is probably a repair date.The first vicar was Richard de Standon in 1225,the present one is Rev.William Gibbs,who took office in 1968. In the aisles,above the piers,are seven grotesque heads.On the roof beams is a series of seven carved wooden heads reputed to portray Shakespear's Seven Ages of Man.Above the tower arch are the Royal coat of arms in painted wood. There are 9 stained glass windows and several marble memorial plaques on the walls,there are 6 bells in the tower.
